description: For the Kremlin, Donald Trump is making all of Vladimir Putin’s dreams come true in Ukraine.
title: Russia Delights in the Dressing Down of Zelenskiy in Oval Office

description: As President Donald Trump greeted Volodymyr Zelenskiy in the Oval Office on Friday, he told reporters it was an honor to welcome the Ukrainian leader for an “exciting moment” — signing a landmark deal securing access to critical minerals in Ukraine meant to pave the way for a peace agreement with Russia.
title: How Trump and Zelenskiy’s Oval Office Skirmish Broke a Deal

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday, White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump’s Ukraine Plan Hits a Roadblock After Oval Office Blowup

description: Illinois Governor JB Pritzker on Friday warned that neither his state nor others across the country could make up for the potential loss of billions of dollars if President Donald Trump and Congressional Republicans slash Medicaid funding.
title: Illinois’ Pritzker Warns of ‘Devastating’ Effects If Trump Cuts Medicaid

description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent characterized the visit of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy to the White House on Friday as “unacceptable.”
title: Bessent Calls Zelenskiy’s Stand at White House Unacceptable

description: Senator Cynthia Lummis, the sponsor of a bill calling for the US to set up a Bitcoin reserve, suggested that progress on the proposal is likely to take longer than many crypto advocates would like.
title: Bitcoin Reserve Is Likely to Come First From States, Senator Lummis Says

description: Canadian Foreign Minister Melanie Joly says it’s crucial that her country and other allies work with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy on reaching a good peace deal for his country to counter Russian aggression.
title: Allies Must Work With Zelenskiy After Spat With Trump, Canada’s Joly Says

description: Mexico is willing to raise tariffs on Chinese goods and find ways to buy more from the US in a bid to avoid duties threatened by President Donald Trump, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Mexico Open to New Tariffs on China to Avoid Trump Duties

description: Democrats sued President Donald Trump over an executive order that they argue would eliminate the bipartisan nature of the Federal Election Commission by shifting legal authority to the White House.
title: Trump Sued by Democratic Party Over Federal Election Commission Independence

description: At least 24 senior leaders of the Social Security Administration have announced their departures, as the government pension agency unveiled a reorganization plan to streamline bureaucracy under a mandate from President Donald Trump.
title: Social Security Shake-Up Sees at Least Two Dozen Officials Leave

description: The cancellation of nearly three-dozen cybersecurity contracts at the US Consumer Financial Protection Bureau endangers the security of sensitive data maintained by the federal watchdog, a former senior official at the bureau said in court documents filed Friday.
title: CFPB Data Imperiled by Cybersecurity Contract Cancellation, Ex-Official Says

description: President Donald Trump’s meeting Friday with Volodymyr Zelenskiy quickly devolved into a testy exchange, with the Ukrainian leader casting doubt on the likelihood US efforts to broker a deal with Russia would yield lasting peace.
title: Trump, Zelenskiy Devolve Into Bickering Before Deal Signing

description: Tens of thousands of people have been killed in the four decades since Kurdish separatist group the PKK took up arms against the Turkish government.
title: Why Kurdish PKK Leader’s Ceasefire Call Matters for Turkey

description: President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva tapped Gleisi Hoffmann, the head of his leftist Workers’ Party, to lead Brazil’s Ministry of Institutional Relations, putting a harsh critic of the central bank and fiscal austerity in charge of leading political negotiations with the country’s congress.
title: Lula Taps Leftist Ally to Lead Government’s Outreach to Congress

description: An electoral court suspended the political rights of Ecuador’s second-in-command for engaging in what it said was gender-related violence, effectively removing her from office amid her feud with President Daniel Noboa.
title: Ecuador Judge Suspends Vice President’s Rights for Two Years

description: The Italian government is planning to meet with UniCredit SpA Chief Executive Andrea Orcel as early as Monday to discuss topics including the bank’s hostile bid for Banco BPM, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: UniCredit Chief Orcel to Meet Italy Officials to Talk Bank Deals

description: Conflict between humans and wild animals in Namibia is escalating as a severe drought intensifies competition for food and water in rural areas, and the problem is being exacerbated by outdated policies, a parliamentary report published Friday says.
title: Drought Pits Human Against Animals in Namibian Tussle for Food

description: China’s vice premier said Beijing and Washington should seek ways to work together, even as President Donald Trump announced additional tariffs on the world’s second-largest economy.
title: China Vice Premier Stresses Cooperation with US in Beijing Event

description: President Donald Trump on Friday lost a bid to halt a federal court’s pause on his executive order limiting birthright citizenship.
title: Trump Birthright Order Is Left Frozen by Appeals Court

description: Europe needs to coordinate spending on armaments and include Norway and the UK, Norwegian Prime Minister Jonas Gahr Store said.
title: Norway’s Leader Says Europe Should Buy More Weapons Together

description: Officials from Germany’s conservative CDU/CSU bloc and the Social Democrats will continue talks on forming a coalition government next week following a first meeting on Friday.
title: German Conservatives, SPD to Continue Coalition Talks Next Week

description: The Trump administration is rapidly cutting office leases, adding space to an already strained commercial real estate market.
title: DOGE Risks a New $5 Billion Headache for Struggling US Landlords

description: Key organizers of last year’s student-led uprising in Bangladesh have launched a new political party, setting the stage for an intense electoral battle in the South Asian nation, which is expected to hold polls by December.
title: Bangladesh Students Who Ousted Hasina Launch Political Party

description: The US’s top diplomat in South Africa resigned with immediate effect amid heightened diplomatic tensions between the two nations.
title: Top US Diplomat in South Africa Resigns With Immediate Effect

description: US President Donald Trump’s plan to revoke Chevron Corp.’s operating license in Venezuela threatens to force the nation’s oil sector back into the shadows, paving the way for corruption and huge discounts in the Asian market.
title: Chevron Wind-Down Would Send Venezuela Back to Oil Market’s Dark Side

description: Anneliese Dodds, UK minister for international development, has resigned from Keir Starmer’s government over the decision to cut foreign aid to fund higher defense spending.
title: Starmer’s Foreign Aid Minister Quits Over Cuts to Fund Defense

description: Portuguese Prime Minister Luis Montenegro said he’ll make a personal and political assessment after facing questions on potential conflicts of interest in relation to a company owned by his family.
title: Portugal Premier to Make Political ‘Assessment’ on Family Firm

description: The Social Security Administration has cut half of its outsourced information technology spending, slashing expenditures for private-sector contractors as part of an effort to keep full-time staff employed, the agency’s acting commissioner told employees Wednesday.
title: Social Security Contractors Cut Off as DOGE Targets Agency

description: Romania’s government survived a no-confidence vote tabled by the far-right opposition at a time of growing anti-establishment sentiment in the Black Sea country.
title: Romania’s Government Survives Ouster Attempt By Far-Right

description: Italy’s cabinet has approved a new legal framework aimed at reintroducing nuclear power generation, as Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni’s government looks to overturn a decades-long ban.
title: Italy Takes First Step Toward Return to Nuclear Generation

description: They're being kept far more than 72 hours, despite a plunge in border crossings, according to an immigration advocate and a person familiar with the matter.
title: US Tent Facility is Holding Migrant Families Longer Than Recommended

description: Italian Premier Giorgia Meloni’s government approved about €3 billion-worth ($3.12 billion) of measures to help families and businesses cope with high energy prices.
title: Italy Cabinet Approves Measures to Reduce Italians’ Energy Bills

description: Somalia may grant landlocked Ethiopia access to a port on the Indian Ocean, a step that may help end a dispute between the neighboring nations over Addis Ababa’s quest to have a direct trade route to the sea.
title: Somalia Weighs Indian Ocean Port Access for Neighboring Ethiopia

description: Health services are at breaking point in rebel-controlled eastern Democratic Republic of Congo as fighting continues and the situation is exacerbated by the US government’s decision to cut funding.
title: Chaos Reigns in Congo as Trump Aid Blow, War Stretch Healthcare

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Israeli Army Apology Shifts Focus to Netanyahu

description: As President Donald Trump lashes out at government agencies across Washington, one of his favorite first-term targets – the Federal Reserve – has been getting a relatively easy ride.
title: Trump Dials Back Fed-Bashing, Seeks a Different Kind of Rate Cut

description: Namibia’s Supreme Court unanimously rejected an opposition bid to annul the outcome of last year’s presidential elections, which was won by the ruling party’s candidate.
title: Namibia’s Top Court Rejects Challenge to Election Outcome

description: Ukraine expects to reach an agreement with the International Monetary Fund as early as this week, paving the way for another payout of aid from its $15.5 billion loan program, people familiar with the matter said.
title: Ukraine Nears IMF Deal on Next Payout From $15.5 Billion Package

description: China has abruptly replaced the nation’s tech czar who oversees Beijing’s efforts to build a world-class, cutting-edge chip industry and rival the US as a high-tech superpower.
title: China Abruptly Replaces Tech Czar Behind AI and Chip Push

description: Thailand is set to appoint a former bureaucrat as the new chairman of the Bank of Thailand, capping a contentious selection process that saw the government fail in a bid to push through the candidacy of a controversial former minister.
title: Thailand Picks Central Bank Board Chair After Contentious Search

description: Rwanda is courting European football clubs to maintain sponsorship deals as the Democratic Republic of Congo steps up pressure on the associations to sever ties, accusing its neighbor of destabilizing its mineral-rich eastern region.
title: Rwanda Courts Arsenal, Bayern, PSG to Stay Put Despite Congo Conflict

description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban said he’ll move to ban the country’s annual Pride parade, raising fears of a wider crackdown on civil liberties ahead of elections.
title: Orban Moves to Ban Hungary’s Pride Parade Before Elections

description: Greeks are protesting throughout the country on Friday to mark the second anniversary of the nation’s deadliest train crash.
title: Greeks Hold Protest to Mark Two Years Since Deadly Train Crash

description: The UK entered the final stage of a process to select small modular reactor technologies that may be key to the country’s net zero goals.
title: UK Enters Final Stage of Contest for Next-Generation Reactors

description: UK house prices rose again in February, according to Nationwide Building Society, as the property market remains resilient to tough economic conditions and looming tax rises.
title: UK House Prices Rebound From Slow Start to 2025, Nationwide Says

description: India’s Prime Minister Narendra Modi and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen agreed to seal a trade deal this year, in an attempt to deepen ties at a time the US President continues to upend global trade and politics.
title: India, EU Aim to Conclude Free Trade Deal This Year

description: Singapore Prime Minister Lawrence Wong defended an election year budget featuring a list of handouts after opposition figures criticized the measures as a short-sighted solution for addressing rising living costs.
title: Singapore Leader Defends Election Year Handouts After Criticism

description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer will host Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy and more than a dozen other European leaders in London on Sunday to discuss security guarantees the continent can offer Kyiv in the event of a ceasefire with Russia.
title: Starmer Will Host European Leaders to Plan Next Steps on Ukraine

description: A spate of drills by China’s military in the Indo-Pacific is testing the Trump administration’s commitment to regional security soon after its actions raised doubts about its alliances with European nations.
title: China’s Military Drills Near US Allies Seen as Test for Trump

description: Doug Ford won a third straight election to lead Ontario, as voters in Canada’s manufacturing heartland opted for a familiar face to steer an economy that’s under threat from US President Donald Trump’s trade policy.
title: Doug Ford Wins Third Majority in Ontario Election Dominated by Trade

description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy arrives at the White House on Friday with a personal appeal to persuade Donald Trump not to sell out his country in the rush to make a peace deal with Russia.
title: Trump Softens Tone on Zelenskiy, But Not on Backing for Ukraine

description: President Donald Trump unveiled additional tariffs on Chinese imports, raising the risk of Beijing ramping up its retaliation and a spiraling of tensions between the world’s two largest economies.
title: Trump Piles Pressure on Xi With Latest Threat to Raise Tariffs

description: Chinese stocks dropped after US President Donald Trump said he would impose an additional 10% tax on the Asian nation’s imports, a development that adds to investors’ worries about intensifying trade tensions.
title: Chinese Stocks Fall as Trump Says US Will Impose More Tariffs

description: The latest US tariff threats have spurred investors to game out how China might respond, with moves like fresh stimulus and looser monetary policy seen to be on the table.
title: Trump’s Latest Tariff Jolt Has Markets Alert for China Response

description: Colombian President Gustavo Petro said he’ll make more changes to his cabinet in the near future.
title: Colombian President Says More Cabinet Changes Are Coming Soon

description: Applications for unemployment benefits filed by federal employees almost tripled last week as the impact of the Trump administration’s firings start to appear, according to Department of Labor data posted Thursday.
title: Jobless Claims by US Federal Workers Surge After Firings

description: The US Justice Department said on Thursday it officially released information related to deceased financier and registered sex offender Jeffrey Epstein that was mostly “previously leaked.”
title: DOJ Releases Epstein Documents It Says Mostly ‘Leaked’ Before

description: Hundreds of employees at the top US agency overseeing weather and climate research were fired as the Trump administration moves to shrink the size of the federal government.
title: At Least 880 Workers Were Fired at US Weather Agency
